page.title: 02WITTON PARK - PAST & PEOPLE
page.content: Many of the residents of Witton Park have lived from thirty to fifty years in the village and express regret at the way it has been run down. Many people have moved to Bishop Auckland, but the residents who remain value the fresh air and scenery. The people expressed a wish to restore the village rather than see it disappear and stress the need for more new houses and improvements to property an roads. The annual carnival is well supported and many "exiles" and relatives return for this colourful event. Conversation turns to the old picture house, Quadrini's ice cream shop, long gone streets (King St., Albion St., Thompson St.), the Station and the Iron Works. We witnessed the demolition of the Salvation Army hall!
